intro: Campanula macrostyla f. rosea, commonly known as the rose-flowered bellflower, is a cultivar of the Campanula genus native to Europe. It is characterized by its showy, rose-pink to lavender-colored flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. Its flowers are bell-shaped, with five to six lobes, and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and is often used in borders or as a cut flower.
